subject: RE: AST_request_LA Witch: Birthday: A Coming Of Age Fantasy
body:
Hello Maria,

This is my second attempt to reply to you, the first one timed out.

In answer to  your question, yes, the Russian rights to L.A. Witch:
Birthday are available. It is also the first of eight (8) books in the
series.

Very Sincerely,
Todd McCaffrey

please reply-to: todd@toddwriter.com

subject: Watch MasterClass with my free Guest Pass
body:
Hey there!

 Hope things are going well. I’ve been watching MasterClass and it’s been
awesome so far.

 They have a Guest Pass feature that lets friends of members experience
MasterClass for free. Thought you might be interested so I’m sending one
your way.

 You can use this Guest Pass link to get set up:
https://www.masterclass.com/s/17b063c5

subject: Re: Hello!
body:
Yes, it was wild. Getting ready to head back to Vegas.
I really wish we could have talked more, I think you're very engaging.
Would you like to talk sometime?
And what only pays $7 an hour (eek!)?
Also there seemed to be more you wanted to say about your last name.
And you had questions for me, what are they?
Cheers,
Todd

On Sun, Jul 24, 2022, 10:42 Azuree Obregon <azuree.obregon@gmail.com> wrote:

> Hi Todd!
> It was very nice to meet you! Thank you, we had a great time the rest of
> the day! I hope you did, too. It seemed awfully busy, so I'm sure this
> weekend has been hectic.
> Sincerely,
> Azurée
>
> On Thu, Jul 21, 2022, 8:23 PM Todd McCaffrey <todd427@gmail.com> wrote:
>
>> Hi Azuree!
>> It was great meeting you this afternoon. I hope the rest of the day went
>> well for you.
>> Cheers,
>> Todd McCaffrey
>>
>

subject: Hello!
body:
Hi Azuree!
It was great meeting you this afternoon. I hope the rest of the day went
well for you.
Cheers,
Todd McCaffrey

subject: The Dragonriders of Pern Mini-Handbook
body:
Attached: The Dragonriders of Pern Mini-Handbook.rtf
Sent using Google Docs https://docs.google.com/

Second try.
Weird. Don't know what happened to the first try.

This is a courtesy copy of an email for your record only. It's not the same  
email your collaborators received. Visit  
https://support.google.com/drive/?p=courtesy_copy to learn more.

subject: Pern age problem
body:
First, Lessard is 21 when Jaxom is born. That makes her 38 at the time of
The White Dragon, and Jaxom, 17.

However, if it's absolutely vital to reduce the age gap,  we could rewrite
history so that Jaxom is born to Gemma the day after Fax's Ruatha Hold
invasion.

Gemma would fake labor to protect Lessa (who was going to try knitting
Fax). Gemma would die but everyone else would decide that Jaxom was dead
too until Lessa, grieving, discovers that the baby is alive.

She takes Jaxom partly in pennance but also because they become each
other's alibi - Lessa can't be a child if she's just given birth and Jaxom
can't be Gemma's if he's got a mother.

Fax, in his rage, kills the watch-wher and has its head mounted above the
hearth.

Lessa raises Jaxom so now, when she's 21, he's 10.

When the dragonriders arrive on Search, they discount Lessa because she's
"too old".

subject: Right One!
body:
The Winner Twins, Brittany and Brianna, are national bestselling,
multiple-award winning novelists, and Pinnacle award-winning teachers. They
became America’s youngest national bestselling authors at age thirteen with
their award-winning novel, The Strand Prophecy. Now adults, they have
written two books in the Strand Series, a scifi-romance Perfect
Compatibility Test, and a nonfiction series on writing, The Write Path.
Recognized as prodigies by the World’s Council for The Gifted and Talented,
the twins went on to create a nonprofit company, Motivate 2 Learn. They
teach their award-winning writing methods as staff members at UCLA
extension.  In combination with New York Times bestselling author Todd
McCaffrey, who is known for his work in The Dragonriders of Pern® series,
they have created the fantasy steampunk Twin Soul Series, with twenty books
available. Their most recent work is The Magpie’s War, a historical fantasy
written with Todd McCaffrey.

subject: Postcard text
body:
The Winner Twins, Brittany and Brianna, are national bestselling,
multiple-award winning novelists, and Pinnacle award-winning teachers. They
became America’s youngest national bestselling authors at age thirteen with
their award-winning novel, The Strand Prophecy. Now adults, they have been
written two books in the Strand Series, a scifi-romance Perfect
Compatibility Test, and a nonfiction series on writing,
The Write Path. Recognized as prodigies by the World’s Council for The
Gifted and Talented, the twins went on to create a nonprofit company,
Motivate 2 Learn. They teach their award-winning writing methods as staff
members at UCLA extension.  In combination with New York Times bestselling
author Todd McCaffrey, who is known for his work in The Dragonriders of
Pern® series, they have created the pen name McCaffrey-Winner and written
the historical fantasy, The Magpie’s War, as well as the fantasy steampunk
Twin Souls Series, with twenty books available.

Sincerely,
Synology DiskStation

Cheers,
Todd

subject: GAM-50 - LightSwitch - McCaffrey, Todd
body:
Attached!  (the switch dims the light to cyan, then brightens it to red if
pressed again).

subject: Hit Game (resend)
body: Sorry, the first version was only a scene, rather than a package.

subject: GAM-50 3HitGame McCaffrey, Todd
body: Ici voila!

subject: MDA Game Play Comments
body:
Game Played:  Kingdom Title Fight

Liked

The game turned itself off quickly.

Three actions: Attack, Defend, Alliance.

I liked that if someone tries for an Alliance and the “partner” attacks,
the Alliance person loses multiple points (stab in the back).

I liked the artwork points board.


Aesthetics

                Dice play to resolve conflicts


Recommendations

                The dice action restricts the game to tabletop and slows
things down.  Perhaps a different way of resolving “ties” could be used?
(Example: what if the high-point person always lost?)

subject: My kid got hit by a car
body:
Hi,

He's alive but apparently flew 20 feet in the air before landing on the 
ground.   They took him to USC (which is odd because he was on his way 
to an appointment at the Children's Hospital in LA).  He had a fracture 
of both the tibia and fibula and scrapes and bruises all over the 
place.  He's up in the ICU at the moment (fingers crossed).

However, working on the presumption that all goes well, he'll be on 
crutches when he gets out, which is going to make getting him to classes 
difficult.

All of which is preparatory to asking: would it be possible to switch 
from the 8:45 class to the 12:45 class?
(It may be that I have to drop all 3 of my classes to deal with the 
kidlet, as we've got a second floor apartment.)

-- Todd

subject: McCaffrey - GAM-35 homework assignment (take 2)
body:
Sorry, I just discovered that I had a few duplicate "Session 1" screens,
they're deleted in this version.

subject: Todd McCaffrey, 8:45 AM March 12 Questions
body:
1. What is User Acquisition?

User acquisition is the process by which a new user is acquired.  It could
come from providing a demo of the game, providing some level of free play
or using other incentives.

2. What is Monetization?

Monetization is the process of determining the average amount of income
from each customer.  Not all customers will be paying customers,
monetization allows a developer to get a feel for overall revenue from a
particular product.

3. What is the theory of the Long Tail?

The theory of the Long Tail is that there are a category of long-term
customers who will remain with a product for a great length of time and
that their overall purchases can exceed the near-term revenue.

subject: GAM35-Writing-Mar3-McCaffrey-Todd
body:
Here's my Question A answer.

-- Todd
